services.cache
Class Cache

java.lang.Object
  services.cache.Cache

public class Cache
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides access to a disk-based cache. Its main use is intended to be the caching of rendered LaTeX labels so that they don't have to be re-rendered all the time.

Author:
Lenko Grigorov

Field Detail

CACHE_EXPIRY

private static final int CACHE_EXPIRY
This determines when files will be purged from the cache. If an item in the cache has not been used for longer than this period of time (in seconds), it will be deleted when the cache is closed.

See Also:
close(), Constant Field Values

CACHE_DIR

private static final java.lang.String CACHE_DIR
The directory where the cache files will be kept.

public static void put(java.lang.String key,

Put a Serializable object into the cache.

get

public static java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String key)
                            throws NotInCacheException
Retrieve an object from the cache.

Parameters:
key - the key used to retrieve the object
Returns:
the object retrieved
Throws:
NotInCacheException - when the object is not found in the cache
See Also:
put(String, Object)

close

public static void close()
Close and finalize the cache.

After a call to this method, the cache should not be used unless init() is called again.

See Also:
init()
